entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 11:35AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICY CONDITIONS TO LINGER ACROSS THE ANCHORAGE BOWL INTO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... Patches of ice may linger across area roadways, especially less traveled secondary roads, through Sunday afternoon due to the combination of air temperatures in the lower to mid 30s and road surface temperatures around or slightly below freezing.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage

entry.summary: ...Wintry Mix of Precipitation Possible Through Tuesday... Mixed precipitation continues to be possible mainly north of the Seward Peninsula Sunday and Monday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 6:14AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Mixed Precipitation This Weekend... An Arctic Front will move west to east across the North Slope Sunday and Monday and will bring a mix of rain, snow, and freezing rain. Precipitation may start as rain or freezing rain before changing to snow. Any ice accumulation is expected to be very light. The best chances for freezing rain will be Sunday
